title: Yvette Fielding confirms modern ghosts exist, not just Victorian kids
text:
Confirmed: you can totally get ghosts from any era come and visit (Picture: UKTV)

When you think of a ghost, chances are you’re probably imagining a child in Victorian clothing or a monk from years gone by, but Yvette Fielding says you can totally get in contact with spirits who have died much more recently.

The host of Most Haunted has finally answered the question posed by one of our favourite memes (you know, the one that goes ‘How come when a house is “haunted, it’s always a ghost from the 1800s? Imagine a ghost from 2007 screaming “IT’S BRITNEY B***H” at 3am’) and confirmed that could totally happen.

While they may not be a huge fan of Britney Spears, Yvette revealed that they have been in contact with several ghosts of people who died much more recently than the 1800s.

She told Metro.co.uk: ‘You do get ghosts of people who have died more recently, we had a man come through who was one of the last people to get hanged in the UK before it was banned in the 1960s.

‘He was protesting his innocence, and saying he knew the person who actually committed the crime, and we have also had murder victims from the 1990s come through so it’s not always a Victorian child.

‘It’s usually people who have had traumatic deaths that come through the most, but yes, you can make contact with spirits from more recent times as well as historical.’

Yvette also explained why we’re all obsessed with trying to make contact with the other side: ‘I think it’s a comfort to know that life doesn’t end when we die.

How come when a house is 'haunted' its always a ghost from the 1700s? imagine a ghost from 2007 screaming "ITS BRITNEY BITCH" at 3 am. — Amber Joy (@officialambrjoy) September 18, 2017

‘I think people like to know there is life after death and that our loved ones are still around us and able to communicate with us too.’

The former Blue Peter presenter turned professional ghost hunter revealed that her programmes have gained a lot of younger fans who find reassurance that there is something on the other side.

Yvette has investigated a lot of ghosts over the past 17 years (Picture: UKTV)

Yvette, who will be hosting a special ghost hunting event for kids this weekend, explained: ‘I love hearing children’s thoughts on the paranormal and what they think happens when we die.

‘And I think it can be a great comfort to know grandma and grandpa aren’t just gone, they are still around us but in a better place.

‘I am excited to see the equipment we are going to be using this weekend and hopefully we will contact something in the bowels of the Argos store!’

Yvette has teamed up with Argos to host a Halloween ghost hunt for kids in their Tottenham Court Road store on Sunday (27 October), inspired by LEGO’s new Hidden Side toy range, where she will entertain attendees with ghost stories from the surrounding streets of London. Tickets to Arghost: LEGO Ghost Hunting Live are available here.

Yvette will be leading kids around a ghost hunt in the spooky store (Picture: Argos)
